metadata.title: CVE-2022-1050 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU implementation of VMWare's paravirtual RDMA device. This flaw allows a crafted guest driver to execute HW commands when shared buffers are not yet allocated, potentially leading to a use-after-free condition.

notes.note: mdeslaur> as of 2022-06-09, proposed fix has not been committed upstream

criterions.comment: qemu package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-06-09').
